# Directed Faith Community Reintegration Project (DFCRP) Tender Announcement

## Project Overview
The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) is seeking proposals from qualified suppliers to provide services for the Directed Faith Community Reintegration Project (DFCRP). The project aims to promote the reintegration of offenders from the Black community into Halifax society through faith-based initiatives.

## Project Objectives
The objectives of the project are to:

* Provide targeted support to offenders from the Black community to help them reintegrate into Halifax society
* Foster partnerships between the CSC, local faith communities, and other community organizations to enhance offender support services
* Develop a holistic approach to offender reintegration that accounts for their unique spiritual and cultural needs
* Improve public safety by reducing recidivism rates among offenders from the Black community

## Scope of Work
The successful supplier will be responsible for:

* Collaborating with the CSC, faith communities, and other community organizations to develop and implement a holistic approach to offender reintegration
* Providing targeted support services to offenders from the Black community, including faith-based counseling, mentorship, and community engagement
* Developing and maintaining relationships with faith communities and other community organizations to promote offender reintegration
* Coordinating with the CSC and other stakeholders to ensure a consistent and evidence-based approach to offender reintegration

## Eligibility and Qualification
To be eligible, suppliers must:

* Have at least two years of experience in Providing services to offenders from the Black community
* Show a proven track record of working with faith communities and other community organizations to promote offender reintegration
* Demonstrate a commitment to providing high-quality services that meet the unique needs of offenders from the Black community

## Tender Requirements
The tender requirements include:

* A statement of capabilities that outlines the supplier's experience, qualifications, and approach to the project
* A detailed project plan that outlines the scope of work, timelines, and milestones
* A budget that outlines the estimated costs of the project

## Evaluation Criteria
The evaluation criteria include:

* Experience and qualifications of the supplier
* Appropriateness of the supplier's approach to the project
* Quality of the project plan and budget
* Commitment to providing high-quality services to offenders from the Black community

## Closing Date
The closing date for submissions is April 9, 2024, at 2:00 p.m. EST. Suppliers who are interested in submitting a proposal must register their expression of interest with the CSC procurement team before the closing date.
